summary: The Outdoor Recreational Outfitting and Guiding Act (H.R. 3499) seeks to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938. It proposes an exemption from minimum wage and maximum hours requirements for employees primarily engaged in outdoor recreational outfitting or guiding services, provided the business meets specific criteria: either operating for no more than seven months a year or having significantly uneven revenue across the year. The act is cited as the Outdoor Recreational Outfitting and Guiding Act and includes an effective date for the amendment.
